original:
The distinction between poetry and other forms of writing often hinges on the intention behind the creation. For instance, when a poet composes a series of lines with the intention of crafting a poem, the act of writing itself imbues those lines with poetic qualities. In contrast, if a journalist records the same lines as shorthand notes for a future article, those lines do not constitute a poem, despite their identical wording.

Leo To
